content.description: Fun moderate with an overhung start. The crux is low, but the first two bolts are easy enough to clip. No rest immediately after the overhang—keep going. Rest of the route is more like 5.6 and mossy, but still fun.
content.protection: 5 bolts, anchors. There is a bolt high above for lowering down to setup a TR.
content.location: Far left side of Section 2 wall before the ravine separating 2 and 3.

content.description:
Straightline route up to the anchors. Reach-y/balance-y at the bottom for the grade. Good pockets in the middle. 

More slabby and fewer positive holds to the anchors. In fact, it looks like most people go just high enough to hook a quickdraw to the end of the chains. Direct to the anchors is a blank slab; there are better, not super, holds to the right that take you even with the anchor but those are very dirty.
content.protection: 4 good bolts. Rusty but solid chains.
content.location: First bolted line on the far right of the slab. Need to rope up and lower from a tree to set a top rope.

content.description: Straight-ahead easy/moderate Trillium route. Like it's neighbor to the right, decently safe lead falls for an easy route. Biggest moves through the first two bolts, middle cruise, then slabby spice to the last bolt. There are plenty of crimps above the slab, but the big holds aren't as good as they look.
content.location: Middle of main wall. Anchors are safely reachable from above.

content.description: It's a short slab with merciful bolting. A good intro to outdoor climbing or leading. Lots of holds and never steep, though hands are a bit sloping for a 5.4.
content.location: Far right route of Section 2. Kind of on its own with a second set of anchors between Sections 1 and 2.

content.description: New route I bolted 10/23. It looked like it was going to be a fun 5.8 arete but it’s way easier at like 5.4. It will be a good easy warm up or a nice first lead. You could rap off a tree to get down to the anchors to TR it but it’d be easier to just lead it.
content.protection: 3 lead bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with quick links. All stainless bolts.
content.location: Just to the right of the main slab. There’s a small maybe 5.0 missy gully and it’s just to the right of that. Next to the mosssy 5.3.

content.description: Anchors at the top of a very mossy slab. Doesn't seem to see much traffic. Your choices are: rap in from a tree anchor to set a TR; highball boulder the moss; scrub the moss and boulder; or climb something else. I'd vote for the last option.
content.protection: Rusty chains. No bolts. Maybe there are cracks for gear under the moss, but I doubt it.
content.location: In the right sub-section of Section 2.

content.description: Start on some good jugs for 2-3 bolts and then head up an easy featured slab and top out on a small ledge. This is a nice spot to hang out and belay your partner up.
content.location: Far left of section 2. Section 2 is the main wall in center with the bench. Go left around the little arete and it’s right next to a gully crack.

content.description: The main slab with several easy routes
